alert.note: Alert for Sanilac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 2:39PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Sanilac County through 315 PM EDT... At 237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sandusky, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Deckerville and Carsonville around 255 PM EDT. Forestville around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Decker, Palms, Watertown, McGregor, Forester, Snover, Juhl, Elmer and Richmondville. Additional stronger storms will move in from Tuscola County and into western Sanilac county between 300 and 315 PM. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
